title: typeface for Miles Reid bluenote cover
content:
Hi there,

Long story short, i would like to know if there is a perfect match for the chunky sans serif used on this cover

first I thought about a Berthold BE bold extended, but the lowercase is clearly different

then I thought about Aurora grotesk and went with Annonce by Canada type, an almost perfect match ... apart from the lowercase "r" whose ear is way longer.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/annonce/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/annonce/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/annonce/")

Is there any other viable option apart from choping off the ear (ouch) of Annonce "r"?

many many thanks,

L.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cawthra_chp4_12j_4195.jpg)
author: L.

comments.content:
[Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness) or [Venus](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/venus) ( [Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/venus-sb) version by Scangraphic) might work (or match actually if only [Venus Extended Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/typophile.com/node/41686#comment-256320) was digitized).  
A list of **similars to Annonce** now: [Doublewide](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/betatype/doublewide/), [Azidenz Grotesk Extended Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/), [Titling Gothic Extended/Wide Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/titling-gothic-fb/), [Zeppelin 43/51 Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/), [Reservation Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/reservation-wide/), [Presicav](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119054144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/presicav/)
thanks @ryuk , Venus was an excellent match
